description:
In America, Prof Jay Bhattacharya, the lockdown sceptic once derided by NIH chief Francis Collins as a "fringe epidemiologist", is about to take over as NIH head in truly sweet karma. But the UK is still mired in denial.

The post Five Years On, the UK Refuses to Learn the Lessons of the Covid Catastrophe appeared first on The Daily Sceptic.
title: Five Years On, the UK Refuses to Learn the Lessons of the Covid Catastrophe

description:
Reform UK was in meltdown last night after the party revealed it had stripped the whip from Rupert Lowe, one of its MPs, amid allegations of bullying staff and violent threats, which he denies, saying he has been "knifed".

The post Reform UK in Meltdown as Party Ousts MP Rupert Lowe Amid “Bullying” Probe and “Violent Threats” appeared first on The Daily Sceptic.
title: Reform UK in Meltdown as Party Ousts MP Rupert Lowe Amid “Bullying” Probe and “Violent Threats”

description:
Suddenly EU leaders have gone into hysterical meltdown over the United States threatening to withdraw security guarantees. Trouble is, says Eugyppius, Eurotards know nothing about how to create a modern army.

The post Hysterical Eurotards Know Nothing About How to Create a Modern Army appeared first on The Daily Sceptic.
title: Hysterical Eurotards Know Nothing About How to Create a Modern Army

description:
Chapter 11 of Declined is here – a dystopian satire by Molly Kingsley about the emergence of a social credit system in the UK. This week: a visit to a black market butcher puts the non-Efficients at risk of being caught.

The post Declined: Chapter 11: Robert’s appeared first on The Daily Sceptic.
title: Declined: Chapter 11: Robert’s

description:
Last year UN chief Antonio Guterres visited Samoa and filmed a deserted house that he claimed was abandoned due to climate change. In fact it was the tsunami. This is not the first time Guterres has misinformed the public.

The post If António Guterres Can’t Get Basic Facts Right, Why Should We Believe the UN on Anything? appeared first on The Daily Sceptic.
title: If António Guterres Can’t Get Basic Facts Right, Why Should We Believe the UN on Anything?

description:
Those who talk about far Right, hard Right or Right-wing extremism are probably finding a scapegoat for their own systematic internalised fascism, suggests Prof James Alexander.

The post Those Who Talk about ‘Far Right’ and ‘Hard Right’ are Probably Finding a Scapegoat for their Own Internalised Fascism appeared first on The Daily Sceptic.
title: Those Who Talk about ‘Far Right’ and ‘Hard Right’ are Probably Finding a Scapegoat for their Own Internalised Fascism

description:
A summary of the most interesting stories in the past 24 hours that challenge the prevailing orthodoxy about the ‘climate emergency’, public health ‘crises’ and the supposed moral defects of Western civilisation.

The post News Round-Up appeared first on The Daily Sceptic.
title: News Round-Up
